segment.source: Migrating to App-V 5.1 from a Previous Version
segment.target: Migrating to App-V 5.1 from a Previous Version

segment.source: Migrating to App-V 5.1 from a Previous Version
segment.target: Migrating to App-V 5.1 from a Previous Version

segment.source: Migrating to App-V 5.1 from a Previous Version
segment.target: Migrating to App-V 5.1 from a Previous Version

segment.source: With Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.1, you can migrate your existing App-V 4.6 or App-V 5.0 infrastructure to the more flexible, integrated, and easier to manage App-V 5.1 infrastructure.
segment.target: With Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.1, you can migrate your existing App-V 4.6 or App-V 5.0 infrastructure to the more flexible, integrated, and easier to manage App-V 5.1 infrastructure.

segment.source: However, you cannot migrate directly from App-V 4.x to App-V 5.1, you must migrate to App-V 5.0 first.
segment.target: However, you cannot migrate directly from App-V 4.x to App-V 5.1, you must migrate to App-V 5.0 first.

segment.source: For more information on migrating from App-V 4.x to App-V 5.0, see Migrating from a Previous Version
segment.target: For more information on migrating from App-V 4.x to App-V 5.0, see Migrating from a Previous Version

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: App-V 5.1 packages are exactly the same as App-V 5.0 packages.
segment.target: App-V 5.1 packages are exactly the same as App-V 5.0 packages.

segment.source: There has been no change in the package format between the versions and therefore, there is no need to convert App-V 5.0 packages to App-V 5.1 packages.
segment.target: There has been no change in the package format between the versions and therefore, there is no need to convert App-V 5.0 packages to App-V 5.1 packages.

segment.source: For more information about the differences between App-V 4.6 and App-V 5.1, see the Differences between App-V 4.6 and App-V 5.0 section of About App-V 5.0.
segment.target: For more information about the differences between App-V 4.6 and App-V 5.1, see the Differences between App-V 4.6 and App-V 5.0 section of About App-V 5.0.

segment.source: Improvements to the App-V 5.1 Package Converter
segment.target: Improvements to the App-V 5.1 Package Converter

segment.source: You can now use the package converter to convert App-V 4.6 packages that contain scripts, and registry information and scripts from source .osd files are now included in package converter output.
segment.target: You can now use the package converter to convert App-V 4.6 packages that contain scripts, and registry information and scripts from source .osd files are now included in package converter output.

segment.source: You can also use the parameter with the cmdlet to specify which .osd files’ information is converted and placed within the new package.
segment.target: You can also use the parameter with the cmdlet to specify which .osd files’ information is converted and placed within the new package.

segment.source: New in App-V 5.1
segment.target: New in App-V 5.1

segment.source: Prior to App-V 5.1
segment.target: Prior to App-V 5.1

segment.source: New .xml files are created corresponding to the .osd files associated with a package; these files include the following information:
segment.target: New .xml files are created corresponding to the .osd files associated with a package; these files include the following information:

segment.source: environment variables
segment.target: environment variables

segment.source: shortcuts
segment.target: shortcuts

segment.source: file type associations
segment.target: file type associations

segment.source: registry information
segment.target: registry information

segment.source: scripts
segment.target: scripts

segment.source: You can now choose to add information from a subset of the .osd files in the source directory to the package using the parameter.
segment.target: You can now choose to add information from a subset of the .osd files in the source directory to the package using the parameter.

segment.source: Registry information and scripts included in .osd files associated with a package were not included in package converter output.
segment.target: Registry information and scripts included in .osd files associated with a package were not included in package converter output.

segment.source: The package converter would populate the new package with information from all of the .osd files in the source directory.
segment.target: The package converter would populate the new package with information from all of the .osd files in the source directory.

segment.source: Example conversion statement
segment.target: Example conversion statement

segment.source: To understand the new process, review the following example package converter statement.
segment.target: To understand the new process, review the following example package converter statement.

segment.target: If the source directory (OldPkgStoreContosoApp) includes the following:

segment.target: X.osd

segment.source: Registry information
segment.target: Registry information

segment.source: Scripts
segment.target: Scripts

segment.source: Each .osd file is converted to a separate, corresponding .xml file that contains the items listed here in App-V 5.1 deployment configuration format.
segment.target: Each .osd file is converted to a separate, corresponding .xml file that contains the items listed here in App-V 5.1 deployment configuration format.

segment.source: These items can then be copied from these .xml files and placed in the deployment configuration or user configuration files as desired.
segment.target: These items can then be copied from these .xml files and placed in the deployment configuration or user configuration files as desired.

segment.source: In this example, there are three .xml files, corresponding with the three .osd files in the source directory.
segment.target: In this example, there are three .xml files, corresponding with the three .osd files in the source directory.

segment.source: Each .xml file contains the environment variables, shortcuts, file type associations, registry information, and scripts in its corresponding .osd file.
segment.target: Each .xml file contains the environment variables, shortcuts, file type associations, registry information, and scripts in its corresponding .osd file.

segment.source: X.osd
segment.target: X.osd

segment.source: Y.osd
segment.target: Y.osd

segment.source: ContosoApp.appv
segment.target: ContosoApp.appv

segment.source: ContosoApp_DeploymentConfig.xml
segment.target: ContosoApp_DeploymentConfig.xml

segment.source: ContosoApp_UserConfig.xml
segment.target: ContosoApp_UserConfig.xml

segment.source: Environment variables
segment.target: Environment variables

segment.source: Shortcuts
segment.target: Shortcuts

segment.source: File type associations
segment.target: File type associations

segment.source: The information from the .osd files specified in the parameter are converted and placed inside the package.
segment.target: The information from the .osd files specified in the parameter are converted and placed inside the package.

segment.source: The converter then populates the deployment configuration file and the user configuration file with the contents of the package, just as App-V Sequencer does when sequencing a new package.
segment.target: The converter then populates the deployment configuration file and the user configuration file with the contents of the package, just as App-V Sequencer does when sequencing a new package.

segment.source: In this example, environment variables, shortcuts, and file type associations included in X.osd and Y.osd were converted and placed in the App-V package, and some of this information was also included in the deployment configuration and user configuration files.
segment.target: In this example, environment variables, shortcuts, and file type associations included in X.osd and Y.osd were converted and placed in the App-V package, and some of this information was also included in the deployment configuration and user configuration files.

segment.source: X.osd and Y.osd were used because they were included as arguments to the parameter.
segment.target: X.osd and Y.osd were used because they were included as arguments to the parameter.

segment.source: No information from Z.osd was included in the package, because it was not included as one of these arguments.
segment.target: No information from Z.osd was included in the package, because it was not included as one of these arguments.

segment.source: Converting packages created using a prior version of App-V
segment.target: Converting packages created using a prior version of App-V

segment.source: Use the package converter utility to upgrade virtual application packages created using versions of App-V prior to App-V 5.0.
segment.target: Use the package converter utility to upgrade virtual application packages created using versions of App-V prior to App-V 5.0.

segment.source: The package converter uses PowerShell to convert packages and can help automate the process if you have many packages that require conversion.
segment.target: The package converter uses PowerShell to convert packages and can help automate the process if you have many packages that require conversion.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: After you convert an existing package you should test the package prior to deploying the package to ensure the conversion process was successful.
segment.target: After you convert an existing package you should test the package prior to deploying the package to ensure the conversion process was successful.

segment.source: What to know before you convert existing packages
segment.target: What to know before you convert existing packages

segment.source: Issue
segment.target: Issue

segment.source: Workaround
segment.target: Workaround

segment.source: Virtual packages using DSC are not linked after conversion.
segment.target: Virtual packages using DSC are not linked after conversion.

segment.source: Link the packages using connection groups.
segment.target: Link the packages using connection groups.

segment.source: See Managing Connection Groups.
segment.target: See Managing Connection Groups.

segment.source: Environment variable conflicts are detected during conversion.
segment.target: Environment variable conflicts are detected during conversion.

segment.source: Resolve any conflicts in the associated .osd file.
segment.target: Resolve any conflicts in the associated .osd file.

segment.source: Hard-coded paths are detected during conversion.
segment.target: Hard-coded paths are detected during conversion.

segment.source: Hard-coded paths are difficult to convert correctly.
segment.target: Hard-coded paths are difficult to convert correctly.

segment.source: The package converter will detect and return packages with files that contain hard-coded paths.
segment.target: The package converter will detect and return packages with files that contain hard-coded paths.

segment.source: View the file with the hard-coded path, and determine whether the package requires the file.
segment.target: View the file with the hard-coded path, and determine whether the package requires the file.

segment.source: If so, it is recommended to re-sequence the package.
segment.target: If so, it is recommended to re-sequence the package.

segment.source: When converting a package check for failing files or shortcuts.
segment.target: When converting a package check for failing files or shortcuts.

segment.source: Locate the item in App-V 4.6 package.
segment.target: Locate the item in App-V 4.6 package.

segment.source: It could possibly be a hard-coded path.
segment.target: It could possibly be a hard-coded path.

segment.source: Convert the path.
segment.target: Convert the path.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: It is recommended that you use the App-V 5.1 sequencer for converting critical applications or applications that need to take advantage of features.
segment.target: It is recommended that you use the App-V 5.1 sequencer for converting critical applications or applications that need to take advantage of features.

segment.source: See, How to Sequence a New Application with App-V 5.1.
segment.target: See, How to Sequence a New Application with App-V 5.1.

segment.source: If a converted package does not open after you convert it, it is also recommended that you re-sequence the application using the App-V 5.1 sequencer.
segment.target: If a converted package does not open after you convert it, it is also recommended that you re-sequence the application using the App-V 5.1 sequencer.

segment.source: How to Sequence a New Application with App-V 5.1.
segment.target: How to Sequence a New Application with App-V 5.1.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: You must be running the latest version of App-V 4.6 to use coexistence mode.
segment.target: You must be running the latest version of App-V 4.6 to use coexistence mode.

segment.source: Additionally, when you sequence a package, you must configure the Managing Authority setting, which is in the User Configuration is located in the User Configuration section.
segment.target: Additionally, when you sequence a package, you must configure the Managing Authority setting, which is in the User Configuration is located in the User Configuration section.

segment.target: Migrating the App-V 5.1 Server Full Infrastructure

segment.source: There is no direct method to upgrade to a full App-V 5.1 infrastructure.
segment.target: There is no direct method to upgrade to a full App-V 5.1 infrastructure.

segment.target: Use the information in the following section for information about upgrading the App-V server.

segment.source: Additional Migration tasks
segment.target: Additional Migration tasks

segment.source: You can also perform additional migration tasks such as reconfiguring end points as well as opening a package created using a prior version on a computer running the App-V 5.1 client.
segment.target: You can also perform additional migration tasks such as reconfiguring end points as well as opening a package created using a prior version on a computer running the App-V 5.1 client.

segment.source: The following links provide more information about performing these tasks.
segment.target: The following links provide more information about performing these tasks.
